newsitem.title: France: American orders Brazilian regional jets. [corrected 15:15 gmt]
newsitem.headline: American orders Brazilian regional jets. [corrected 15:15 gmt]

text.p: American Airlines has ordered 42 regional jets (corrects number of jets) from Brazil's state-owned Embraer, with an option to buy 25 more, the companies said on Tuesday.
In one of the few announcements so far at the Paris air show, the companies valued the order for Embraer's 50-seat EMB-145 regional passenger jets at nearly $1 billion.
In a separate announcement, engine maker Allison said the aircraft would be powered by its AE 3007A1 engines in an order worth in excess of $275 million.
Allison is a unit of British aerospace group Roll Royce Plc.
An aircraft order was widely expected after American's parent, U.S. airlines giant AMR Corp, said on Monday it planned a press briefing for Tuesday on plans for its regional fleet.
The order is for AMR's domestic carrier American Eagle.
